title: Release preparation for all BSPs w/ rp2040-hal 0.10
body:
Bumped all crate version numbers (for published BSPs).
Added changelog entry for each BSP.

In the changelog for all non-pico boards, I'm only listing dependency changes for *direct* dependencies.
No-one should care that a dependency used by an example has changed.

Once again, most of the time preparing this release was spent writing change logs that I don't think anyone will ever read.

title: Bump rp2040-hal to 0.10.0 and embedded-hal to 1.0
body: ~Depends on unreleased version of [ws2812-pio](https://github.com/rp-rs/ws2812-pio-rs) with rp2040-hal 0.10.0 support~

title: Replace more instances of probe-run by probe-rs run
body: https://github.com/rp-rs/rp-hal-boards/pull/55 reminded me to check for more places where we still refer to probe-run. This is mainly taken from the rp-hal repository, where the change was made a while ago.

title: Feature/deprecated runner in cargo config
body: Using the repo I found that I had to install probe-run, which itselfs complains about being deprecated.

title: Add support for the Pimoroni Tufty 2040
body:
This includes pin numbering and bindings to the ST7789 display.

There is one pretty painful issue: DMA is generally not used for `embedded_graphics` commands, since most commands are generated via an iterator. (This is particularly noticeable at startup, as the st7789 library turns the display on without leaving time for us to clear the screen buffer, which takes a while without DMA.)

However, I don't feel that solving that issue is under the remit of `rp2040-hal`. Ideally `st7789` could do with hooks to allow DMA for long copy operations and its `init()` function needs to be broken up.

title: Check all examples
body: The example pico_rtic_monotonic depends on the feature rp2040-hal/rtic-monotonic. Therefore it wasn't built by CI, so it wasn't noticed that the example was actually broken.

title: Add Sparkfun Micromod RP2040 to README.md
Update boardsource_blok pinout
body: Updated boardsource_blok pinout according to the [pinout of the rp2040](https://datasheets.raspberrypi.com/rp2040/rp2040-datasheet.pdf#io-user-bank-function-table) and the information on [Peg](https://peg.software/docs/blok#main-pro-micro-pins).

title: Avoid hardcoding the IRQ.
Add additional example for the Adafruit KB2040.
Use workspace depdencies.
body: Should make managing boards much easier.

title: Fix out-of-date comment about SPI pins not being used
body: Also replace 'an' with 'the', because SPI could be pronounced ess-pee-eye or spy, so either of those choices is going to annoy someone.

title: Prepare release
Add support for Adafruit Metro RP2040
body:
Adds support for https://www.adafruit.com/product/5786 
Copied mostly from the adafruit-itsy-bitsy-rp2040

title: Replace outdated actions in github workflows
body: Mostly just what we already do in the rp-hal repo.

title: Fix broken link in README
body:
There seems to be a broken link in the README.
Linking to the crate might be appropriate.

title: Sparkfun Micromod: Improve README and Documentation
Add support for the Blok microcontroller
body:
Adds support for the [Blok microcontroller](https://boardsource.xyz/store/628b95b494dfa308a6581622). Based on the documentation of [Peg](https://peg.software/docs/blok).
Personal test of all examples was successful.
Examples: - rainbow - reset_to_usb_boot - usb_keyboard_input
Thank you for your time and effort dear rp-rs Developers.

title: Use released version 0.5.0 of embedded-sdmmc
Lets use patches to rp-rs' repositories
use newer rp2040-boot2
Add sparkfun-micromod-rp2040 board
body:
Adds support for the [Sparkfun Micromod RP2040](https://www.sparkfun.com/products/17720) board.

- [x] Pin configuration
- [x] Documentation
- [x] Example: Blinky
- [x] Example: Battery Voltage

title: Use prebuilt cargo-udeps binary in CI
body: Same change as https://github.com/rp-rs/rp-hal/pull/534

title: Update probe-run list-probes command in README
body:
Hi, I noticed when I followed the [current instructions](https://github.com/rp-rs/rp-hal-boards/blob/2f8d0f4404c32cf8877c57812dd3649a80431380/README.md?plain=1#L413) in the README to use probe-run, I got an error:

```sh
probe-run --chip RP2040 --list-probes
error: the argument '--chip <CHIP>' cannot be used with '--list-probes'

Usage: probe-run --chip <CHIP> <ELF>

For more information, try '--help'.
```

I'm on macOS Monterey 12.6.5 (21G531) and currently here's my version from probe-run:

```sh
probe-run --version
0.3.8
supported defmt version: 4
```

Once I removed the `--chip` argument I got this:

```sh
probe-run --list-probes
the following probes were found:
[0]: Picoprobe CMSIS-DAP (VID: 2e8a, PID: 000c, Serial: E6616408438E3C21, CmsisDap)
```

I am guessing this is the intended behaviour, and that the `--chip` and `--list-probes` arguments no longer work together.

title: Remove redundant variable in pico uart examples
body:
This removes the hard-coded XTAL_FREQ_HZ variable from the rp-pico UART examples as it's already defined in this library as XOSC_CRYSTAL_FREQ.

I noticed this as I was looking thru the examples and it seems like most of them use the rp_pico::XOSC_CRYSTAL_FREQ value instead. I'm new to embedded so please let me know if I got something wrong here. Thanks!

title: Use internal pull-up in pico_spi_sd_card example

Depends on:
- https://github.com/rp-rs/rp-hal/pull/585
- https://github.com/rp-rs/ws2812-pio-rs/pull/25

title: Bump rp2040-hal to v0.8 across the boards
body: I don't know if this is at all helpful but I saw https://github.com/rp-rs/rp-hal/issues/550 and if there's a new version of rp2040-hal soon, we'll want to use it here.  All boards successfully compile against https://github.com/rp-rs/rp-hal/commit/636992e311bdd0a457e5797208a1c0b888756208

title: Update dependency to latest release of embedded-sdmmc
body:
This avoids a git dependency.

As I don't have the necessary hardware at hand to test this, it is only compile-tested.
